summary: Email chain between attorneys discussing logistics for filing joint letters regarding pseudonyms for witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, including coordination on delivering hard drives for evidence. The correspondence shows legal team coordination on procedural matters related to witness protection and evidence handling.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP coordinating with other legal teams about filing joint letters on pseudonyms and arranging delivery of hard drives for a hearing.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails discussing procedural matters for the Maxwell trial, noted as traveling for a hearing.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails, also noted as traveling for a hearing with Jeff Pagliuca.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney included in email chain regarding pseudonym procedures and evidence logistics.

connections.description: Coordination on legal procedures for the Maxwell trial, including filing joint letters and evidence handling.
Collaboration on trial logistics, with Menninger traveling for a hearing and needing to review proposals.
Both attorneys traveling together for a hearing and involved in same legal coordination.
Both part of email chain discussing procedural matters for witness pseudonyms and evidence.

events.title: Filing deadline for joint letters on pseudonyms
events.description: Deadline for legal teams to file joint letters regarding pseudonyms for witnesses, procedures for their use at trial, and sealing/redacting exhibits.

events.title: Hearing preparation and evidence transfer
events.description: Attorneys coordinate delivery of hard drives containing evidence to be brought to a hearing, with discussion of meeting at 40 Foley Square.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, NY (side entrance mentioned for evidence handoff)
800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP address)
keyFacts: Legal teams were coordinating procedures for using pseudonyms for witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial to protect their identities.
There was a planned transfer of hard drives (4 drives mentioned) containing evidence to be delivered for a hearing.
The correspondence shows active preparation for trial procedures including sealing exhibits and limiting instructions regarding pseudonyms.
Attorneys Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger were traveling for a hearing on November 9, 2021.
The email chain demonstrates coordination between multiple law firms on procedural matters in a high-profile case.
